text:
I sent a payoff for my credit builder plus loan via cashier's check on June 26, 2023. I have been calling every week for an explanation as to why my loan has not been paid off. I called my bank to place a stop pay on the check the other day but was informed that the check was deposited into their account on July 24,2023. Everytime I speak with a customer care specialist they say it has not arrived to them and they have to escalate the issue to another department to be researched and they will email me. When asked to speak to that department, I was told they could not allow the customer to be in contact with them. I barely receive any correspondence from them regarding the issue. Today I had to demand to speak with a supervisor and the supervisor read the same script until I told him I was going to obtain legal counsel. I am going to sue them for emotional distress, attorney fees, etc because this is ridiculous. Their customer service also sucks because as a customer you have to repeat yourself with every person you speak with even when they do a warm transfer. Everyone reads from the same script and there is no personalized genuine engagement with the customer.  

Update: I just received an email stating they did receive the check and are processing my payoff after I left my reviews and informed them that I was seeking legal counsel to resolve this issue. Lol such a coincidence

Update/reply: My issue is not resolved yet because my payoff has not been processed almost 1 month after my check was deposited into their business account. I'm still being charged interest, regular payments, and membership fees. Can anyone say suspicious activity/emotional distress?
title: Scammers and Fraudsters

reply.message: We truly understand how frustrating a situation like this would be, Bennica, and are happy to see that one of our customer advocates was able to address and resolve this matter for you.

text: I have had Moneylion for years and they were the best. I would get my paycheck two days early. However, yesterday, they closed my account suddenly. I asked what happened but all they would tell me was to refer to the demand deposit agreement. I am so shocked. Customer service was rude and would not allow me to speak to management nor explain to me what happened. DO NOT USE THEM. THEY ARE HORRIBLE FOR WHAT THEY DID. I have money in there that I can't get access to. My money!!! It's truly sad.

text: These have to paid reviews of some sort. Its been a nightmare banking with Moneylion. In June I got a random email from them stating my account has been put on hold. No reason nothing, this before I had to pay some big bills. I reached out to the customer service and lets just say I was stuck on calls for hours upon hours. Nothing resolved and I had to send statements, screenshots etc of myself holding my license( still no reason why account is on hold) finally a day or two later my account is reinstated no apology nothing. Fast forward 8/7/2023 i get an email that my account is closed, you can imagine the frustration am dealing with right now. I have opened a complaint with the BBB and plan on suing moneylion.
title: CAUTION do NOT bank with these crooks!

text: Still haven‚Äôt received my money as of 8/2/23‚Ä¶On July 1st I did a transfer incorrectly. Rather than doing a transfer from my MoneyLion acct to my Navy acct, I did it from my Navy to MoneyLion. That day, my Navy acct couldn‚Äôt cover the transfer request. Navy required me pay $29 for insufficient funds but MoneyLion has put a block on my acct since then. They requested pictures of my drivers license, front and back. A copy of my bank statement and a photo. The problem with my bank statement is it says absolutely nothing about a transaction. With MoneyLion because no transfer was made. My statement says payment of $29, insufficient funds. Nothing about MoneyLion because nothing went through. I have called every week and been told ‚Äúit‚Äôs being escalated‚Äù. I‚Äôve also been told I need to submit the pictures of license, myself and bank statement 4 times counting today. The total amount is only $750. I contacted the BBB and they are looking into this but I am absolutely spreading the word on MoneyLion. Everyday I tell at least 1 person about this to spread the word. I made the initial mistake but it‚Äôs 4 weeks later. Oh yeah, I also took a screenshot of the incorrect transfer request. I sent this to them as well as additional proof of who I am. Since it‚Äôs time stamped and shows a date it further backs my identity and explains the issue‚Ä¶ apparently not though.
title: Don‚Äôt trust MoneyLion

text: I was approved for $595. In the middle of the cycle, $400 in, the amount changed to $400. When I questioned this I was told my boosts had expired and was assured as soon as I repaid they would reset. So I repaid early. When I did this it dropped to $170!!!! When I asked about this it all fell apart. First I was told that my direct deposit was being deposited to my debit card so that was the why, then I when I proved that was incorrect it was I didn‚Äôt have enough consecutive deposits, I‚Äôve had the same account for years, and it was one thing after the other. My bank told me I was being scammed and would be better off to cut my losses and run. I think they‚Äôre right.
title: I was approved for $595

text: Is it fraud or abuse when: ... a company that has access to your bank, unilaterally changes the date agreed upon to withdraw funds? Or when a company refuses to correct a reoccurring problem? Offers loans that are not real loans? Or when customer service fails to respond to complaints, fix complaint tickets, and gives you the run around for weeks on end? Moneylion should be reported to the Better Business Bureau bbb.org, trustpilot.com. our State's Attorney General to stop these practices
title: Is it fraud or abuse?
